alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 15 at 7:15AM MST until February 15 at 7:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON... .Min RH values drop into the single digits to lower teens this afternoon as an upper level system approaches from the west. Winds will also increase during the midday and afternoon hours, with values 20 to 25 mph. These strong winds coupled with the very dry and moderately unstable air, in addition to above normal temperatures, will lead to critical fire weather conditions through the afternoon and early evening hours. The worst conditions will likely be west of the Rio Grande, and over the east slopes of the Sacramento mountains and Black Range. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 110, 111, 112, and 113 in Southwest and South Central New Mexico. * WIND...Southwest winds 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...7 to 14 percent. * HIGHEST THREAT...is located across fire weather zone 111 in Southwest New Mexico. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Southwest Deserts and Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
